description:
Everything about him is shrouded in mystery. The mask he can't remove. The past he can't unravel. And the very survival of the people who have chosen him as their leader. But what Hakuoro does know is this: he was gravely injured and left for dead in a forest. A kind young girl named Eluluu found him and nursed him back to health. He was welcomed into a barren land where strange creatures roam, an angry god seeks vengeance, an oppressive government slaughters the innocent, and a bloody war looms on the horizon. Will the masked hero liberate the people who saved him? Can he unlock the memories that elude him? Or will he remain a stranger even to himself?

(Source: Funimation)

tags.name: War
tags.description: Partly or completely set during wartime.

tags.name: Amnesia
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) with memory loss.

tags.name: Post-Apocalyptic
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a world or civilization after a global disaster.

tags.name: Kemonomimi
tags.description: Prominently features humanoid characters with animal ears.

tags.name: Politics
tags.description: Centers around politics, politicians, or government activities.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Lost Civilization
tags.description: Featuring a civilization with few ruins or records that exist in present day knowledge.

tags.name: Gods
tags.description: Prominently features a character of divine or religious nature.

tags.name: Reincarnation
tags.description: Features a character being born again after death, typically as another person or in another world.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Super Robot
tags.description: Prominently features large robots often piloted by hot-blooded protagonists.

tags.name: Kingdom Management
tags.description: Characters in these series take on the responsibility of running a town or kingdom, whether they take control of an existing one, or build their own from the ground up.

tags.name: Female Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several female characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: Nekomimi
tags.description: Humanoid characters with cat-like features such as cat ears and a tail.

tags.name: Shapeshifting
tags.description: Features character(s) who changes one's appearance or form.

node.description: AQUAPLUS, formally U-Office and Aqua is a Japanese company which mainly specializes in the publishing and distribution of visual novels under their brand Leaf, which produces adult games. Games for all ages are released on AQUAPLUS' name alone. AQUAPLUS is also regularly involved with the production of anime based on Leaf's games. The company is also involved with music, franchised restaurants, and at one point with automobiles.

Singer/Song writer from Tokyo, Japan. She graduated from Tokyo National University of Fine Arts and Music. 
Passed away as a result of a terminal illness on August 4th, 2008

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Suara_FIX) | [Website](https://fixrecords.com/suara/) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/Suara) 

She is married to anime song composer and arranger [Fujita Junpei](https://anilist.co/staff/110557).

John Ledford is an entrepreneur and leader in the North American anime industry. In 1992, he founded A.D. Vision (ADV), paving the way for other businesses and the exponential growth anime has had within North America. With ADV's success, Ledford turned his sights to making the imaginative world of anime even more accessible with Anime Network's founding, North America’s first cable TV network dedicated to anime. He later partnered with Kadokawa Publishing and began Newtype USA with translated Japanese content and exclusive U.S. material related to all things anime, manga, and model reviews. This endeavor expanded into ADV Manga, which obtained licensing and publishing rights for hundreds of Japanese manga and Korean manhwa.

In 2008, Ledford founded a new anime-focused company called Sentai Filmworks (Sentai). Since its founding, Sentai provides thousands of hours of content across traditional and digital platforms. Sentai’s dedication to bringing captivating stories, including acclaimed titles such as Grave of the Fireflies, Ninja Scroll, and High School of the Dead to audiences, is ongoing.

Ledford’s most recent success is with the 2017 founding of the streaming service HIDIVE. Since launching, HIDIVE is now available via a web browser, mobile devices, gaming platforms, and more. HIDIVE offers new simulcasts every season, an ever-growing collection of dubs, and exclusive titles. The service features DUBCAST SM editions, early access local-language dubs of simulcasts directly produced by HIDIVE, as early as two weeks after the original Japanese broadcast.

For nearly thirty years now, Ledford continues his goal to further the expansion of anime and the Japanese culture as a whole.

Masumi Itou is a singer and composer. Ito has composed the soundtracks to many anime television shows and is part of the bands Oranges & Lemons and Heart of Air. She graduated from Musashino College of Music, and her husband is music producer Yoshiyuki Ito.

__Hijiri Anze__ is a Japanese pianist, lyricist, composer and arranger. She was a co-composer of music for the game Resident Evil Code: Veronica.

__[Website](https://akihata.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/akihata_jp) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/akihata.jp/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/c/AKIHATAjp)__

__Aki Hata__ is a Japanese vocalist, lyricist, composer and member of the music production team [Q-MHz](https://anilist.co/staff/156926/QMHz).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/岩佐岳)

Founder and representative director of [White Fox](https://anilist.co/studio/314/).

After dropping out of university he entered Yoyogi Animation Gakuin. During his time at the school he joined the animation studio [OLM](https://anilist.co/studio/28/), and worked as a production assistant on [Mojakou](https://anilist.co/anime/2736/). Quickly thereafter he rose in rank and established his own animation team, Team Iwasa. Their first work was [Kasumin](https://anilist.co/anime/20858/). His policy for making anime was to make a polite work which is highly regarded by fans.

In 2007, Team Iwasa split from OLM and established itself independently as White Fox.

**Doujin Circle:** CUT A DASH!!

[Blog](http://amaduyu.sblo.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/amaduyu)

He is a painter, graphic artist, illustrator, and doujin writer currently working at the videogame company [Aquaplus](https://anilist.co/staff/97193/Aquaplus).
